verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:7
verse.Greek: Τοὺς δὲ βεβήλους καὶ γραώδεις μύθους παραιτοῦ γύμναζε δὲ σεαυτὸν πρὸς εὐσέβειαν
verse.ULB: But reject profane stories loved by old women. Instead, train yourself in godliness.
verse.residue: But stories loved by old women. Instead, train yourself in .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:8
verse.Greek: ἡ γὰρ σωματικὴ γυμνασία πρὸς ὀλίγον ἐστὶν ὠφέλιμος ἡ δὲ εὐσέβεια πρὸς πάντα ὠφέλιμός ἐστιν ἐπαγγελίαν ἔχουσα ζωῆς τῆς νῦν καὶ τῆς μελλούσης
verse.ULB: For bodily training is a little useful, but godliness is useful for all things. It holds promise for this life now and the life to come.
verse.residue: For bodily training is a little useful, but is useful for all things. It holds for this now and the life to come.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:9
verse.Greek: πιστὸς ὁ λόγος καὶ πάσης ἀποδοχῆς ἄξιος
verse.ULB: This message is trustworthy and worthy of full acceptance.
verse.residue: This is and of full acceptance.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:10
verse.Greek: Εἰς τοῦτο γὰρ κοπιῶμεν καὶ ἀγωνιζόμεθα ὅτι ἠλπίκαμεν ἐπὶ Θεῷ ζῶντι ὅς ἐστιν Σωτὴρ πάντων ἀνθρώπων μάλιστα πιστῶν
verse.ULB: For it is for this that we labor and struggle. For we hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, but especially of believers.
verse.residue: For it is for this that we and . For we in , who is the of all people, but especially of .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:11
verse.Greek: Παράγγελλε ταῦτα καὶ δίδασκε
verse.ULB: Instruct the people and teach these things.
verse.residue: Instruct the people and these things.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:12
verse.Greek: Μηδείς σου τῆς νεότητος καταφρονείτω ἀλλὰ τύπος γίνου τῶν πιστῶν ἐν λόγῳ ἐν ἀναστροφῇ ἐν ἀγάπῃ ἐν πίστει ἐν ἁγνείᾳ
verse.ULB: Let no one despise your youth, but be an example for the believers in speech, conduct, love, faithfulness, and purity.
verse.residue: Let no one despise your youth, but be an example for the in speech, conduct, , , and purity.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:13
verse.Greek: ἕως ἔρχομαι πρόσεχε τῇ ἀναγνώσει τῇ παρακλήσει τῇ διδασκαλίᾳ
verse.ULB: Until I come, attend to the reading, to the exhortation, and to the teaching.
verse.residue: Until I come, attend to the reading, to the , and to the .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:14
verse.Greek: Μὴ ἀμέλει τοῦ ἐν σοὶ χαρίσματος ὃ ἐδόθη σοι διὰ προφητείας μετὰ ἐπιθέσεως τῶν χειρῶν τοῦ πρεσβυτερίου
verse.ULB: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you through prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elders.
verse.residue: Do not neglect the that is in you, which was given to you through , with the laying on of the of the .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:15
verse.Greek: ταῦτα μελέτα ἐν τούτοις ἴσθι ἵνα σου ἡ προκοπὴ φανερὰ ᾖ πᾶσιν
verse.ULB: Care for these things. Be in them, so that your progress may be evident to all people.
verse.residue: Care for these things. Be in them, so that your progress may be evident to all people.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 4:16
verse.Greek: ἔπεχε σεαυτῷ καὶ τῇ διδασκαλίᾳ ἐπίμενε αὐτοῖς τοῦτο γὰρ ποιῶν καὶ σεαυτὸν σώσεις καὶ τοὺς ἀκούοντάς σου
verse.ULB: Give careful attention to yourself and to the teaching. Continue in these things. For by doing so, you will save yourself and those who listen to you.
verse.residue: Give careful attention to yourself and to the . Continue in these things. For by doing so, you will yourself and those who to you.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:1
verse.Greek: Πρεσβυτέρῳ μὴ ἐπιπλήξῃς ἀλλὰ παρακάλει ὡς πατέρα νεωτέρους ὡς ἀδελφούς
verse.ULB: Do not rebuke an older man. Instead, exhort him as if he were a father. Exhort younger men as brothers,
verse.residue: Do not an older man. Instead, him as if he were a . Exhort younger men as ,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:2
verse.Greek: πρεσβυτέρας ὡς μητέρας νεωτέρας ὡς ἀδελφὰς ἐν πάσῃ ἁγνείᾳ
verse.ULB: older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, in all purity.
verse.residue: older women as mothers, and younger women as , in all purity.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:3
verse.Greek: Χήρας τίμα τὰς ὄντως χήρας
verse.ULB: Honor widows, the real widows.
verse.residue: Honor widows, the real widows.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:4
verse.Greek: εἰ δέ τις χήρα τέκνα ἢ ἔκγονα ἔχει μανθανέτωσαν πρῶτον τὸν ἴδιον οἶκον εὐσεβεῖν καὶ ἀμοιβὰς ἀποδιδόναι τοῖς προγόνοις τοῦτο γάρ ἐστιν ἀπόδεκτον ἐνώπιον τοῦ Θεοῦ
verse.ULB: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, let them first learn to show honor in their own household. Let them repay their parents, because this is pleasing to God.
verse.residue: But if a widow has or grandchildren, let them first learn to show in their own . Let them their parents, because this is pleasing to .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:5
verse.Greek: Ἡ δὲ ὄντως χήρα καὶ μεμονωμένη ἤλπικεν ἐπὶ Θεὸν καὶ προσμένει ταῖς δεήσεσιν καὶ ταῖς προσευχαῖς νυκτὸς καὶ ἡμέρας
verse.ULB: But she who is a real widow, who is left all alone, has set her hope in God and continues in offering earnest appeals and prayers night and day,
verse.residue: But she who is a real widow, who is all , has set her in and continues in offering and night and ,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:6
verse.Greek: ἡ δὲ σπαταλῶσα ζῶσα τέθνηκεν
verse.ULB: but the woman who lives for pleasure is dead even while she lives.
verse.residue: but the woman who for pleasure is even while she .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:7
verse.Greek: Καὶ ταῦτα παράγγελλε ἵνα ἀνεπίλημπτοι ὦσιν
verse.ULB: Instruct them in these things as well, so that they may be blameless.
verse.residue: Instruct them in these things as well, so that they may be .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:8
verse.Greek: εἰ δέ τις τῶν ἰδίων καὶ μάλιστα οἰκείων οὐ προνοεῖ τὴν πίστιν ἤρνηται καὶ ἔστιν ἀπίστου χείρων
verse.ULB: But if someone does not provide for his own relatives, especially for those of his own household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
verse.residue: But if someone does not provide for his own relatives, especially for those of his own , he has the and is worse than an .
verse.w: for those of his own household,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:9
verse.Greek: Χήρα καταλεγέσθω μὴ ἔλαττον ἐτῶν ἑξήκοντα γεγονυῖα ἑνὸς ἀνδρὸς γυνή
verse.ULB: Let a woman be enrolled as a widow who is not younger than sixty years old, a wife of one husband.
verse.residue: Let a woman be enrolled as a widow who is not younger than sixty old, a wife of one husband.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:10
verse.Greek: ἐν ἔργοις καλοῖς μαρτυρουμένη εἰ ἐτεκνοτρόφησεν εἰ ἐξενοδόχησεν εἰ ἁγίων πόδας ἔνιψεν εἰ θλιβομένοις ἐπήρκεσεν εἰ παντὶ ἔργῳ ἀγαθῷ ἐπηκολούθησεν
verse.ULB: She must have a reputation for doing good deeds, whether it is that she has cared for children, or has been hospitable to strangers, or has washed the feet of God's holy people, or has relieved the afflicted, or has been devoted to every good work.
verse.residue: She must have a for doing , whether it is that she has cared for , or has been hospitable to strangers, or has washed the feet of God's people, or has relieved the , or has been devoted to every .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:11
verse.Greek: Νεωτέρας δὲ χήρας παραιτοῦ ὅταν γὰρ καταστρηνιάσωσιν τοῦ Χριστοῦ γαμεῖν θέλουσιν
verse.ULB: But as for younger widows, refuse to enroll them in the list. For when they give in to bodily desires against Christ, they want to marry.
verse.residue: But as for younger widows, to enroll them in the list. For when they give in to bodily desires against , they want to marry.
verse.w: to enroll them in the list.
they give in to bodily desires

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:12
verse.Greek: ἔχουσαι κρίμα ὅτι τὴν πρώτην πίστιν ἠθέτησαν
verse.ULB: In this way they incur condemnation because they set aside their first commitment.
verse.residue: In this way they incur because they their first .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:13
verse.Greek: ἅμα δὲ καὶ ἀργαὶ μανθάνουσιν περιερχόμεναι τὰς οἰκίας οὐ μόνον δὲ ἀργαὶ ἀλλὰ καὶ φλύαροι καὶ περίεργοι λαλοῦσαι τὰ μὴ δέοντα
verse.ULB: At the same time, they also learn to be lazy and they go around from house to house. They not only become lazy, but they also talk nonsense and are busybodies, saying things they should not say.
verse.residue: At the same time, they also learn to be lazy and they go around from to house. They not only become lazy, but they also talk nonsense and are busybodies, saying things they should not say.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:14
verse.Greek: Βούλομαι οὖν νεωτέρας γαμεῖν τεκνογονεῖν οἰκοδεσποτεῖν μηδεμίαν ἀφορμὴν διδόναι τῷ ἀντικειμένῳ λοιδορίας χάριν
verse.ULB: I therefore want younger women to marry, to bear children, to manage the household, and to give no opportunity for the enemy to slander us.
verse.residue: I therefore want younger women to marry, to bear , to manage the , and to give no opportunity for the to us.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:15
verse.Greek: ἤδη γάρ τινες ἐξετράπησαν ὀπίσω τοῦ Σατανᾶ
verse.ULB: For some have already turned aside after Satan.
verse.residue: For some have already aside after .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:16
verse.Greek: Εἴ τις πιστὴ ἔχει χήρας ἐπαρκείτω αὐταῖς καὶ μὴ βαρείσθω ἡ ἐκκλησία ἵνα ταῖς ὄντως χήραις ἐπαρκέσῃ
verse.ULB: If any believing woman has widows, let her help them, so that the church will not be burdened, so that it might help the real widows.
verse.residue: If any woman has widows, let her help them, so that the will not be , so that it might help the real widows.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:17
verse.Greek: Οἱ καλῶς προεστῶτες πρεσβύτεροι διπλῆς τιμῆς ἀξιούσθωσαν μάλιστα οἱ κοπιῶντες ἐν λόγῳ καὶ διδασκαλίᾳ
verse.ULB: Let the elders who rule well be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who labor with the word and in teaching.
verse.residue: Let the who be considered of double honor, especially those who with the and in .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:18
verse.Greek: λέγει γὰρ ἡ γραφή Βοῦν ἀλοῶντα οὐ φιμώσεις καί Ἄξιος ὁ ἐργάτης τοῦ μισθοῦ αὐτοῦ
verse.ULB: For the scripture says, "You must not put a muzzle on an ox while it threshes the grain" and "The laborer is worthy of his wages."
verse.residue: For the scripture says, "You must not put a muzzle on an while it the grain" and "The is of his ."

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:19
verse.Greek: Κατὰ πρεσβυτέρου κατηγορίαν μὴ παραδέχου ἐκτὸς εἰ μὴ ἐπὶ δύο ἢ τριῶν μαρτύρων
verse.ULB: Do not receive an accusation against an elder unless there are two or three witnesses.
verse.residue: Do not an against an unless there are two or three .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:20
verse.Greek: Τοὺς ἁμαρτάνοντας ἐνώπιον πάντων ἔλεγχε ἵνα καὶ οἱ λοιποὶ φόβον ἔχωσιν
verse.ULB: Correct sinners before all so that the rest may be afraid.
verse.residue: Correct before all so that the rest may be .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:21
verse.Greek: Διαμαρτύρομαι ἐνώπιον τοῦ Θεοῦ καὶ Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ καὶ τῶν ἐκλεκτῶν ἀγγέλων ἵνα ταῦτα φυλάξῃς χωρὶς προκρίματος μηδὲν ποιῶν κατὰ πρόσκλισιν
verse.ULB: I solemnly command you, before God and Christ Jesus and the chosen angels, to keep these commands without partiality, and to do nothing out of favoritism.
verse.residue: I solemnly command you, before and and the , to these without , and to do nothing out of favoritism.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:22
verse.Greek: Χεῖρας ταχέως μηδενὶ ἐπιτίθει μηδὲ κοινώνει ἁμαρτίαις ἀλλοτρίαις σεαυτὸν ἁγνὸν τήρει
verse.ULB: Place hands hastily on no one. Do not share in the sins of another person. You should keep yourself pure.
verse.residue: Place hastily on no one. Do not share in the of another person. You should yourself .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:23
verse.Greek: Μηκέτι ὑδροπότει ἀλλὰ οἴνῳ ὀλίγῳ χρῶ διὰ τὸν στόμαχον καὶ τὰς πυκνάς σου ἀσθενείας
verse.ULB: You should no longer drink water. Instead, you should take a little wine for the stomach and your frequent sicknesses.
verse.residue: You should no longer drink . Instead, you should take a little for the stomach and your frequent sicknesses.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:24
verse.Greek: Τινῶν ἀνθρώπων αἱ ἁμαρτίαι πρόδηλοί εἰσιν προάγουσαι εἰς κρίσιν τισὶν δὲ καὶ ἐπακολουθοῦσιν
verse.ULB: The sins of some people are openly known, and they go before them into judgment. But some sins follow later.
verse.residue: The of some people are openly known, and they go before them into . But some sins follow later.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 5:25
verse.Greek: ὡσαύτως καὶ τὰ ἔργα τὰ καλὰ πρόδηλα καὶ τὰ ἄλλως ἔχοντα κρυβῆναι οὐ δύνανται
verse.ULB: In the same way, some good works are openly known, but even the others cannot be hidden.
verse.residue: In , some are openly known, but even the others be hidden.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:1
verse.Greek: Ὅσοι εἰσὶν ὑπὸ ζυγὸν δοῦλοι τοὺς ἰδίους δεσπότας πάσης τιμῆς ἀξίους ἡγείσθωσαν ἵνα μὴ τὸ ὄνομα τοῦ Θεοῦ καὶ ἡ διδασκαλία βλασφημῆται
verse.ULB: Let all who are under the yoke as slaves regard their own masters as worthy of all honor. They should do this so that the name of God and the teaching might not be blasphemed.
verse.residue: Let all who are under the as regard their own as of all . They should do this so that the of and the might not be .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:2
verse.Greek: οἱ δὲ πιστοὺς ἔχοντες δεσπότας μὴ καταφρονείτωσαν ὅτι ἀδελφοί εἰσιν ἀλλὰ μᾶλλον δουλευέτωσαν ὅτι πιστοί εἰσιν καὶ ἀγαπητοὶ οἱ τῆς εὐεργεσίας ἀντιλαμβανόμενοι Ταῦτα δίδασκε καὶ παρακάλει
verse.ULB: The slaves who have believing masters should not show them disrespect because they are brothers. Instead, they should serve them all the more. For those who receive the benefit are believers and beloved. Teach and declare these things.
verse.residue: The who have should not show them disrespect because they are . Instead, they should serve them all the more. For those who receive the benefit are and . Teach and these things.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:3
verse.Greek: Εἴ τις ἑτεροδιδασκαλεῖ καὶ μὴ προσέρχεται ὑγιαίνουσιν λόγοις τοῖς τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ καὶ τῇ κατ᾽ εὐσέβειαν διδασκαλίᾳ
verse.ULB: If anyone teaches false doctrine and does not agree with the truthful words of our Lord Jesus Christ and with godly teaching,
verse.residue: If anyone teaches false and does not agree with the of our and with ,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:4
verse.Greek: τετύφωται μηδὲν ἐπιστάμενος ἀλλὰ νοσῶν περὶ ζητήσεις καὶ λογομαχίας ἐξ ὧν γίνεται φθόνος ἔρις βλασφημίαι ὑπόνοιαι πονηραί
verse.ULB: he is proud and understands nothing. He has an unhealthy interest in controversies and arguments about words that result in envy, strife, insults, evil suspicions,
verse.residue: he is and nothing. He has an unhealthy interest in controversies and arguments about words that result in , , , suspicions,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:5
verse.Greek: διαπαρατριβαὶ διεφθαρμένων ἀνθρώπων τὸν νοῦν καὶ ἀπεστερημένων τῆς ἀληθείας νομιζόντων πορισμὸν εἶναι τὴν εὐσέβειαν
verse.ULB: and constant conflict between people who have morally corrupt minds. They have lost the truth and they think that godliness is a way to get more money. \f + \ft Some old copies add the exhortation, \fqa Stay away from such things. \fqa* But the best ancient copies do not. \f*

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:6
verse.Greek: Ἔστιν δὲ πορισμὸς μέγας ἡ εὐσέβεια μετὰ αὐταρκείας
verse.ULB: Now godliness with contentment is great gain,
verse.residue: Now with contentment is gain,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:7
verse.Greek: οὐδὲν γὰρ εἰσηνέγκαμεν εἰς τὸν κόσμον ὅτι οὐδὲ ἐξενεγκεῖν τι δυνάμεθα
verse.ULB: for we brought nothing into the world, and we can take nothing out of it.
verse.residue: for we brought nothing into the , and we take nothing out of it.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:8
verse.Greek: ἔχοντες δὲ διατροφὰς καὶ σκεπάσματα τούτοις ἀρκεσθησόμεθα
verse.ULB: Instead, let us be satisfied with food and clothing.
verse.residue: Instead, let us be satisfied with food and clothing.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:9
verse.Greek: Οἱ δὲ βουλόμενοι πλουτεῖν ἐμπίπτουσιν εἰς πειρασμὸν καὶ παγίδα καὶ ἐπιθυμίας πολλὰς ἀνοήτους καὶ βλαβεράς αἵτινες βυθίζουσιν τοὺς ἀνθρώπους εἰς ὄλεθρον καὶ ἀπώλειαν
verse.ULB: Now those who desire to become wealthy fall into temptation, into a trap. They fall into many foolish and harmful desires, and into whatever else sinks people into ruin and destruction.
verse.residue: Now those who to become wealthy fall into , into a . They fall into many and , and into whatever else sinks people into ruin and .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:10
verse.Greek: ῥίζα γὰρ πάντων τῶν κακῶν ἐστιν ἡ φιλαργυρία ἧς τινες ὀρεγόμενοι ἀπεπλανήθησαν ἀπὸ τῆς πίστεως καὶ ἑαυτοὺς περιέπειραν ὀδύναις πολλαῖς
verse.ULB: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people who desire it have been misled away from the faith and have pierced themselves with much grief.
verse.residue: For the of money is a root of all kinds of . Some people who it have been misled away from the and have themselves with much grief.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:11
verse.Greek: Σὺ δέ ὦ ἄνθρωπε Θεοῦ ταῦτα φεῦγε δίωκε δὲ δικαιοσύνην εὐσέβειαν πίστιν ἀγάπην ὑπομονήν πραϋπαθίαν
verse.ULB: But you, man of God, flee from these things. Pursue righteousness, godliness, faithfulness, love, endurance, and gentleness.
verse.residue: But you, , from these things. Pursue , , , , , and gentleness.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:12
verse.Greek: ἀγωνίζου τὸν καλὸν ἀγῶνα τῆς πίστεως ἐπιλαβοῦ τῆς αἰωνίου ζωῆς εἰς ἣν ἐκλήθης καὶ ὡμολόγησας τὴν καλὴν ὁμολογίαν ἐνώπιον πολλῶν μαρτύρων
verse.ULB: Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of the everlasting life to which you were called, and about which you gave the good confession before many witnesses.
verse.residue: Fight the fight of . Take hold of the to which you were , and about which you gave the before many .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:13
verse.Greek: Παραγγέλλω σοι ἐνώπιον τοῦ Θεοῦ τοῦ ζωογονοῦντος τὰ πάντα καὶ Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ τοῦ μαρτυρήσαντος ἐπὶ Ποντίου Πιλάτου τὴν καλὴν ὁμολογίαν
verse.ULB: I give these orders to you before God, who gives life to all things, and before Christ Jesus, who testified before Pontius Pilate and made the good confession,
verse.residue: I give these to you before , who gives to all things, and before , who before and made the ,

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:14
verse.Greek: τηρῆσαί σε τὴν ἐντολὴν ἄσπιλον ἀνεπίλημπτον μέχρι τῆς ἐπιφανείας τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν Ἰησοῦ Χριστοῦ
verse.ULB: to keep the command without spot or blame until the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verse.residue: to the without spot or blame until the appearance of our .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:15
verse.Greek: ἣν καιροῖς ἰδίοις δείξει ὁ μακάριος καὶ μόνος Δυνάστης ὁ Βασιλεὺς τῶν βασιλευόντων καὶ Κύριος τῶν κυριευόντων
verse.ULB: God will reveal Christ's appearing at the right time—God, the blessed and only Sovereign, the King who reigns and the Lord who rules.
verse.residue: will reveal Christ's appearing at the —God, the and only Sovereign, the King who and the who .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:16
verse.Greek: ὁ μόνος ἔχων ἀθανασίαν φῶς οἰκῶν ἀπρόσιτον ὃν εἶδεν οὐδεὶς ἀνθρώπων οὐδὲ ἰδεῖν δύναται ᾧ τιμὴ καὶ κράτος αἰώνιον ἀμήν
verse.ULB: Only he has immortality and dwells in inapproachable light. No man sees him or is able to view him. To him be honor and eternal dominion. Amen.
verse.residue: Only he has immortality and dwells in inapproachable . No man sees him or to view him. To him be and . Amen.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:17
verse.Greek: Τοῖς πλουσίοις ἐν τῷ νῦν αἰῶνι παράγγελλε μὴ ὑψηλοφρονεῖν μηδὲ ἠλπικέναι ἐπὶ πλούτου ἀδηλότητι ἀλλ᾽ ἐπὶ Θεῷ τῷ παρέχοντι ἡμῖν πάντα πλουσίως εἰς ἀπόλαυσιν
verse.ULB: Instruct the rich in this world not to be proud and not to hope in riches, which are uncertain. Instead, they should hope in God. He offers to us all the true riches to enjoy.
verse.residue: Instruct the rich in this not to be and not to in riches, which are uncertain. Instead, they should hope in . He offers to us all the true riches to enjoy.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:18
verse.Greek: ἀγαθοεργεῖν πλουτεῖν ἐν ἔργοις καλοῖς εὐμεταδότους εἶναι κοινωνικούς
verse.ULB: Tell them to do good, to be rich in good works, and to be generous and willing to share.
verse.residue: Tell them to , to be rich in , and to be generous and willing to share.

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:19
verse.Greek: ἀποθησαυρίζοντας ἑαυτοῖς θεμέλιον καλὸν εἰς τὸ μέλλον ἵνα ἐπιλάβωνται τῆς ὄντως ζωῆς
verse.ULB: In that way they will store up for themselves a good foundation for what is to come, so that they will take hold of real life.
verse.residue: In that way they will store up for themselves a for what is to come, so that they will take hold of real .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:20
verse.Greek: Ὦ Τιμόθεε τὴν παραθήκην φύλαξον ἐκτρεπόμενος τὰς βεβήλους κενοφωνίας καὶ ἀντιθέσεις τῆς ψευδωνύμου γνώσεως
verse.ULB: Timothy, protect what was given to you. Avoid the profane and empty talk and the conflicting ideas of what is falsely called knowledge.
verse.residue: , protect what was given to you. Avoid the and empty talk and the conflicting ideas of what is falsely .

verse.name: 1 Timothy 6:21
verse.Greek: ἥν τινες ἐπαγγελλόμενοι περὶ τὴν πίστιν ἠστόχησαν Ἡ χάρις μεθ᾽ ὑμῶν
verse.ULB: Some men proclaim these things and so they have gone astray from the faith. May grace be with you.
verse.residue: Some men these things and so they have gone astray from the . May be with you.
